oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Grace Episcopal Church: front view
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Eatherly, Brad, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of a board and batten wooden church constructed in the Carpenter Gothic style, viewed from the east. The church is built upon a gentle slope along Highway 31 with a sidewalk leading up to a small set of steps. The steps interrupt a rock wall that borders the property on two sides. A wrought iron fence and gate separate the sidewalk and the church property. Two red doors, a chimney, two stained glass windows are visible. The lower window was added in 1888. The gabled end of the sanctuary has a steeple attached to it with a cross sitting atop. The steeple has a belfry inside with a bell built in 1839.

Grace Episcopal Church was established in 1877 with the completion of the church building. It was constructed by P.J. Williamson in the Carpenter Gothic style along the Main Street in Spring Hill at a cost of $1800.00, funded by members of the church and friends from the community.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Church buildings
Episcopal churches; Stained glass
